verses.verse: What <S%G5101><s%> shall we say <S%G3004><s%> then <S%G3767><s%>? Are we to continue <S%G1961><s%> in sin <S%G266><s%> that grace <S%G5485><s%> might increase <S%G4121><s%>?
May it never <S%G3361><s%> be! How <S%G4459><s%> shall we who <S%G3748><s%> died <S%G599><s%> to sin <S%G266><s%> still <S%G2089><s%> live <S%G2198><s%> in it?

Or <S%G2228><s%> do you not know <S%G50><s%> that all <S%G3745><s%> of us who <S%G3745><s%> have been baptized <S%G907><s%> into Christ <S%G5547><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> have been baptized <S%G907><s%> into His death <S%G2288><s%>?

Therefore <S%G3767><s%> we have been buried <S%G4916><s%> with Him through <S%G1223><s%> baptism <S%G908><s%> into death, <S%G2288><s%> in order <S%G2443><s%> that as Christ <S%G5547><s%> was raised <S%G1453><s%> from the dead <S%G3498><s%> through <S%G1223><s%> the glory <S%G1391><s%> of the Father, <S%G3962><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> we too <S%G2532><s%> might walk <S%G4043><s%> in newness <S%G2538><s%> of life. <S%G2222><s%>

For if <S%G1487><s%> we have become <S%G1096><s%> united <S%G4854><s%> with [Him] in the likeness <S%G3667><s%> of His death, <S%G2288><s%> certainly <S%G235><s%> we shall be also <S%G2532><s%> [in the likeness] of His resurrection, <S%G386><s%>

knowing <S%G1097><s%> this, <S%G3778><s%> that our old <S%G3820><s%> self <S%G444><s%> was crucified <S%G4957><s%> with [Him,] that our body <S%G4983><s%> of sin <S%G266><s%> might be done <S%G2673><s%> away <S%G2673><s%> with, that we should no <S%G3371><s%> longer <S%G3371><s%> be slaves <S%G1398><s%> to sin; <S%G266><s%>
for he who has died <S%G599><s%> is freed <S%G1344><s%> from sin. <S%G266><s%>
Now <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> we have died <S%G599><s%> with Christ, <S%G5547><s%> we believe <S%G4100><s%> that we shall also <S%G2532><s%> live <S%G4800><s%> with Him,

knowing <S%G3609><s%> that Christ, <S%G5547><s%> having been raised <S%G1453><s%> from the dead, <S%G3498><s%> is never <S%G3765><s%> to die <S%G599><s%> again; <S%G3765><s%> death <S%G2288><s%> no <S%G3765><s%> longer <S%G3765><s%> is master <S%G2961><s%> over <S%G2961><s%> Him.

For the death that He died, <S%G599><s%> He died <S%G599><s%> to sin, <S%G266><s%> once <S%G2178><s%> for all; <S%G2178><s%> but the life <S%G2198><s%> that He lives, <S%G2198><s%> He lives <S%G2198><s%> to God. <S%G2316><s%>

Even <S%G2532><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> consider <S%G3049><s%> yourselves <S%G1438><s%> to be dead <S%G3498><s%> to sin, <S%G266><s%> but alive <S%G2198><s%> to God <S%G2316><s%> in Christ <S%G5547><s%> Jesus. <S%G2424><s%>
Therefore <S%G3767><s%> do not let sin <S%G266><s%> reign <S%G936><s%> in your mortal <S%G2349><s%> body <S%G4983><s%> that you should obey <S%G5219><s%> its lusts, <S%G1939><s%>

and do not go on presenting <S%G3936><s%> the members <S%G3196><s%> of your body to sin <S%G266><s%> [as] instruments <S%G3696><s%> of unrighteousness; <S%G93><s%> but present <S%G3936><s%> yourselves <S%G1438><s%> to God <S%G2316><s%> as those alive <S%G2198><s%> from the dead, <S%G3498><s%> and your members <S%G3196><s%> [as] instruments <S%G3696><s%> of righteousness <S%G1343><s%> to God. <S%G2316><s%>
For sin <S%G266><s%> shall not be master <S%G2961><s%> over <S%G2961><s%> you, for you are not under <S%G5259><s%> law, <S%G3551><s%> but under <S%G5259><s%> grace. <S%G5485><s%>

What <S%G5101><s%> then <S%G3767><s%>? Shall we sin <S%G264><s%> because <S%G3754><s%> we are not under <S%G5259><s%> law <S%G3551><s%> but under <S%G5259><s%> grace <S%G5485><s%>? May it never <S%G3361><s%> be!

Do you not know <S%G3609><s%> that when <S%G3739><s%> you present <S%G3936><s%> yourselves <S%G1438><s%> to someone <S%G3739><s%> [as] slaves <S%G1401><s%> for obedience, <S%G5218><s%> you are slaves <S%G1401><s%> of the one whom <S%G3739><s%> you obey, <S%G5219><s%> either <S%G2273><s%> of sin <S%G266><s%> resulting <S%G1519><s%> in death, <S%G2288><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> of obedience <S%G5218><s%> resulting <S%G1519><s%> in righteousness <S%G1343><s%>?

But thanks <S%G5485><s%> be to God <S%G2316><s%> that though you were slaves <S%G1401><s%> of sin, <S%G266><s%> you became <S%G5219><s%> obedient <S%G5219><s%> from the heart <S%G2588><s%> to that form <S%G5179><s%> of teaching <S%G1322><s%> to which <S%G3739><s%> you were committed, <S%G3860><s%>
and having been freed <S%G1659><s%> from sin, <S%G266><s%> you became <S%G1402><s%> slaves <S%G1402><s%> of righteousness. <S%G1343><s%>

I am speaking <S%G3004><s%> in human <S%G442><s%> terms <S%G442><s%> because <S%G1223><s%> of the weakness <S%G769><s%> of your flesh. <S%G4561><s%> For just <S%G5618><s%> as you presented <S%G3936><s%> your members <S%G3196><s%> [as] slaves <S%G1401><s%> to impurity <S%G167><s%> and to lawlessness, <S%G458><s%> resulting <S%G1519><s%> in [further] lawlessness, <S%G458><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> now <S%G3568><s%> present <S%G3936><s%> your members <S%G3196><s%> [as] slaves <S%G1401><s%> to righteousness, <S%G1343><s%> resulting <S%G1519><s%> in sanctification. <S%G38><s%>
For when <S%G3753><s%> you were slaves <S%G1401><s%> of sin, <S%G266><s%> you were free <S%G1658><s%> in regard to righteousness. <S%G1343><s%>

Therefore <S%G3767><s%> what <S%G5101><s%> benefit <S%G2590><s%> were you then <S%G5119><s%> deriving <S%G2192><s%> from the things of which <S%G3739><s%> you are now <S%G3568><s%> ashamed <S%G1870><s%>? For the outcome <S%G5056><s%> of those <S%G1565><s%> things <S%G1565><s%> is death. <S%G2288><s%>

But now <S%G3570><s%> having been freed <S%G1659><s%> from sin <S%G266><s%> and enslaved <S%G1402><s%> to God, <S%G2316><s%> you derive <S%G2192><s%> your benefit, <S%G2590><s%> resulting <S%G1519><s%> in sanctification, <S%G38><s%> and the outcome, <S%G5056><s%> eternal <S%G166><s%> life. <S%G2222><s%>

For the wages <S%G3800><s%> of sin <S%G266><s%> is death, <S%G2288><s%> but the free <S%G5486><s%> gift <S%G5486><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> is eternal <S%G166><s%> life <S%G2222><s%> in Christ <S%G5547><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> our Lord. <S%G2962><s%>
